Generation V.Black: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
Generation V.White: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokémon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.
Generation V.Black 2: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
Generation V.White 2: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.

Generation VI.X: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
Generation VI.Y: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

Generation VII.Sun: It rides on the wind and slips into people's homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton-filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
Generation VII.Moon: This Pokémon appears, riding upon the wind. But if the wind gusts up, it'll blow the cotton on this Pokémon's head clean off.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: This nuisance sneaks into people's homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Whimsicott doesn't live in a fixed location. It floats around on whirling winds, appearing all over the place to perform its mischief.

Generation VIII.Sword: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it'll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
Generation VIII.Shield: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
Generation IX.Violet: It rides on the wind and slips into people’s homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton- filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.

Generation V.Black: Pinwheel Forest (inner), Lostlorn Forest , Abundant Shrine ( rustling grass )
Generation V.Black 2: Pinwheel Forest (inner), Lostlorn Forest , Castelia City , Abundant Shrine , Victory Road ( rustling grass )

Generation VIII.Sword: Dappled Grove , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Giant's Mirror ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Dappled Grove , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Giant's Mirror ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Ballimere Lake ( Wanderer ) Frostpoint Field , Giant's Bed , Snowslide Slope , Frigid Sea , Ballimere Lake ( Max Raid Battle ) Max Lair ( Dynamax Adventure )
